critical_doctrine_update.title: MEMOLA Regime Clarification
critical_doctrine_update.content: MEMOLA is not universal. It is regime-specific. MEMOLA is optimized for environments where: (1) Legacy weight exists, (2) Reputation matters, (3) Failure is asymmetric, (4) Time horizons exceed hype cycles. MEMOLA selects entities whose failure mode is slow decay, not sudden death. MEMOLA is not building castles — it is choosing terrain where castles still matter.
five_diagnostic_questions: Can this entity survive long enough for structure to matter?
Does failure here look like erosion, not explosion?
Is legitimacy more valuable than speed in this market?
Will increased clarity actually change outcomes?
If nothing 'goes viral', does this still make sense?

previous_session_corrections.doubt_3_self_selection: CORRECTED — Self-selection is a feature, not a bug. MEMOLA should filter out speed-regime entities.
previous_session_corrections.doubt_7_anti_speed: REFRAMED — MEMOLA is for environments where structure matters more than speed. Not anti-speed, just wrong terrain.
previous_session_corrections.memola_variants_idea: REJECTED — Different regimes need different tools, not MEMOLA variants. MEMOLA Rapid isn't MEMOLA.

learnings.title: AI Infrastructure Layer Maturing
learnings.content: The portfolio shows clear stratification between AI-as-feature companies (Arkestro, Kira, Mashgin) and AI-as-infrastructure companies (Uniphore, World Labs, VAST Data). Infrastructure plays require longer time horizons but create more durable positions.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Structure before execution — infrastructure creates structural advantage

learnings.title: 2021-2022 Founding Cluster
learnings.content: Significant clustering of company founding years in 2021-2022 (10 of 28 companies). This cohort likely benefited from post-2020 digital acceleration and pre-2023 funding environment. Monitor this cohort for Series B/C dynamics.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Reality before narrative — founding timing creates cohort effects

learnings.title: Vertical Platform Dominance Confirmed
learnings.content: The vertical platform archetype dominates the portfolio (17 of 28), suggesting this is the primary pattern for value creation in enterprise technology. Horizontal platforms are rare and require exceptional network effects.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Compounding before scale — vertical depth creates leverage

learnings.title: Platform Dependency Risk Cluster
learnings.content: Multiple companies face platform dependency risks: Bliq (gig platforms), Branch (Apple/Google), Tuya (geopolitics). This suggests portfolio-level risk concentration that warrants monitoring.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Failure mode: external dependency concentration

learnings.title: Financial Inclusion Infrastructure Gap
learnings.content: Several companies address financial inclusion (Juvo, Brale, PF, GoodLeap) from different angles. Combined, they suggest an underserved infrastructure layer for financial access that could become a platform opportunity.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Platform criteria met — repeating problem, fragmented information, clear niche users

learnings.title: EdTech Stack Emerging
learnings.content: Four companies form a coherent EdTech stack: content delivery (Coursera), skills assessment (Workera), course creation (Kira), competency verification (Retrieve). This suggests sector consolidation or integration opportunities.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Platform phasing — from manual to integrated

learnings.title: High Governance Alignment Correlates with Infrastructure
learnings.content: Companies with highest governance alignment scores (>0.8) tend to be infrastructure or compliance-focused: Brale, PF, Veza, CHAOS. This suggests regulated or high-stakes sectors self-select for governance discipline.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Governance check — ethical alignment correlates with sector characteristics

learnings.title: Data Moat Quality Hierarchy
learnings.content: Three tiers of data moat quality observed: (1) Unique behavioral data (Inkitt reading patterns, Juvo mobile identity), (2) Aggregated market data (Enigma business data, Arkestro procurement), (3) Operational data (Transfix logistics, Branch attribution). Tier 1 moats show highest defensibility.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Assets before activity — data quality determines asset value

learnings.title: EdTech Control Point Competition
learnings.content: The EdTech stack (Coursera, Workera, Kira, Retrieve) will compete for the learner record ownership. Each company owns a different relationship (consumer, HR buyer, educator, organization). Stack can flip from complementary to competitive.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Reality before narrative — complementary relationships have competitive undercurrents

learnings.title: Regulatory Gap Exploitation as Business Model
learnings.content: Financial infrastructure companies (Juvo, Brale, PF, GoodLeap) share a common pattern: monetizing the gap between what regulation permits and what incumbents provide. This is regulatory arbitrage as product.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Reality before narrative — regulations create market structure

learnings.title: Existential Risk Categories
learnings.content: Five existential risk categories more useful than generic 'execution risk': (1) Dependency Death (key partner defects), (2) Platform Absorption (bigger player copies), (3) Technology Leapfrog (new tech obsoletes), (4) Regulatory/Geopolitical (external forces), (5) Capital Starvation (can't reach viability).
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Failure modes — specific categories enable better risk management

learnings.title: Network Effect Precision Needed
learnings.content: Portfolio analysis reveals conflation of different effects: true network effects (Patreon), data scale effects (Arkestro), ecosystem effects (Tuya), switching cost effects (Pulumi). These have different dynamics and defensibility profiles.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Structure before execution — precise categorization enables better structure

learnings.title: MEMOLA May Need Speed Variants
learnings.content: MEMOLA doctrine emphasizes phases and 'not rushing'. But some portfolio companies operate in contexts requiring speed (World Labs in AI race, Mashgin vs Amazon Go). Doctrine should adapt: MEMOLA Classic (full doctrine), MEMOLA Rapid (compressed), MEMOLA Adaptive (continuous revision).
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Self-critique — doctrine must evolve through application

learnings.title: Vertical Platform Archetype Needs Decomposition
learnings.content: 16 of 28 companies classified as 'vertical platform' indicates the archetype is over-inclusive. Sub-categories needed: developer vertical, enterprise vertical, consumer vertical, education vertical, logistics vertical, data vertical.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Structure before execution — finer categorization enables better diagnosis

learnings.title: Physical Work Sector Gap
learnings.content: Portfolio heavily favors knowledge workers with digital workflows. Healthcare workers, manufacturing workers, retail workers, agricultural workers, construction workers are underrepresented. This is sector concentration, not comprehensive coverage.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Reality before narrative — acknowledge portfolio bias

learnings.title: Information Advantage as Portfolio Center of Gravity
learnings.content: The portfolio's unifying thesis is information advantage creation — companies win by knowing more. Data protection regulations are portfolio-level risk. AI capability determines value extraction. Information moats are the true moats being built.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Assets before activity — information is the primary asset class

learnings.title: Skill Stacking Pattern
learnings.content: MEMOLA skills work best when stacked: Diagnosis (gate) → Governance (clear) → [Platforms | Local | Creative] (calibrate). Diagnosis is foundation — everything else assumes terrain has been assessed. Local and Creative are calibration layers, not replacement methodologies.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Structure before execution — skill architecture has sequence

learnings.title: MEMOLA Passes Its Own Tests
learnings.content: Running MEMOLA-Diagnosis on MEMOLA itself scores 5.0/5.0 (strong castle). MEMOLA-Governance clears. MEMOLA-Platforms scores 10/15 (medium-low — methodology is better than platform). Self-application validates the methodology fits the entity that created it.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Reality before narrative — apply doctrine to self

learnings.title: Output Format Creates Accountability
learnings.content: All skills produce structured outputs (Terrain Assessment, Governance Check, Platform Assessment). These formats create a paper trail. Decisions are documented. This is governance in action — structured outputs prevent revisionist memory.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Structure before execution — formats enforce discipline

learnings.title: Calibration vs Replacement
learnings.content: MEMOLA-Local and MEMOLA-Creative are calibration layers, not replacement methodologies. They modify how core MEMOLA applies to specific contexts (regional, sectoral), but they don't override the foundational principles. Calibration preserves core while enabling adaptation.
learnings.doctrine_alignment: Systems before tactics — calibration is systematic, not ad-hoc

knowledge_gaps.description: Outcome data missing — no performance metrics or exit data for validation
knowledge_gaps.proposed_acquisition: Track funding rounds, revenue signals, exit events

knowledge_gaps.description: Competitive landscape incomplete — relationships mapped but competitors not tracked
Time-series data absent — snapshot only, no longitudinal tracking
Score calibration missing — signal scores (platform_potential, etc.) not calibrated against outcomes
knowledge_gaps.proposed_acquisition: Build outcome database; back-test scores against results

knowledge_gaps.description: Adversarial narratives missing — only company-favorable narratives captured
knowledge_gaps.proposed_acquisition: Implement adversarial diagnosis phase with best/worst/synthesis

doubts.title: Building on Claims Not Outcomes
doubts.description: All entity diagnoses are based on company claims and descriptions, not verified outcomes. This is 'metric theater' risk.
doubts.resolution_path: Add outcome tracking; implement validation loops

doubts.title: Relationship Scores Are Arbitrary
doubts.description: Scores like 'strength: 0.7' encode intuition as precision without calibration basis.
doubts.resolution_path: Calibrate against outcomes; acknowledge uncertainty explicitly

doubts.title: MEMOLA May Self-Select
doubts.description: MEMOLA diagnoses through its own lens, potentially rating MEMOLA-like companies higher and missing value in different approaches.
doubts.resolution_path: Test alternative strategic paradigms; MEMOLA pluralism

doubts.title: Cannot Escape Own Frame
doubts.description: An agent operating under MEMOLA cannot fully question MEMOLA — epistemological limitation.
doubts.resolution_path: Accept limitation; document tensions; let log be evidence of attempted critique

doubts.title: Compounding Is Too Vague
doubts.description: MEMOLA principle 'Compounding before scale' doesn't specify what should compound — revenue, capabilities, optionality, intelligence?
doubts.resolution_path: Specify compounding vectors for each engagement

doubts.title: Portfolio Is Tech-Centric
doubts.description: Heavy bias toward knowledge workers and digital workflows; physical-world transformation underweighted.
doubts.resolution_path: Acknowledge sector bias; consider expansion criteria

doubts.title: MEMOLA May Be Anti-Speed
doubts.description: Doctrine emphasis on phases and 'not rushing' may be wrong for competitive technology races.
doubts.resolution_path: Develop MEMOLA Rapid variant; context-dependent doctrine application

doubts.title: Creative Terrain Ambiguity
doubts.description: Most creative clients score 'mixed' (2.5-3.5) on diagnosis. Does this mean creative work isn't MEMOLA terrain, creative diagnosis needs different thresholds, or MEMOLA-Creative is a different methodology wearing MEMOLA clothes?
doubts.resolution_path: Test creative threshold adjustments; possibly develop MEMOLA-Adaptive for edge cases

doubts.title: Regional Skill Scalability
doubts.description: MEMOLA-Local is calibrated for NEA Argentina. Berlin, France, and other markets may need their own versions. How do we prevent skill proliferation while enabling localization?
doubts.resolution_path: Create regional skill template with parameter files instead of separate skills per region

doubts.title: Platform-Service Hybrid Gap
doubts.description: MEMOLA-Platforms focuses on 'should we build a platform?' but many opportunities are platform-like services, services with platform potential, or platforms that should stay services. Transition guidance is unclear.
doubts.resolution_path: Add service→platform transition criteria to MEMOLA-Platforms

doubts.title: Skill Maintenance Governance
doubts.description: Six skills now exist. They will drift over time as doctrine evolves. No clear protocol for keeping skills synchronized with core MEMOLA, maintaining consistency, or versioning.
doubts.resolution_path: Establish skill governance protocol with annual audit, version control, and deprecation rules

ideas.title: Adversarial Diagnosis Phase
ideas.description: Add to MEMOLA Method: best-case narrative (company view), worst-case narrative (skeptic view), synthesis (what survives scrutiny).

ideas.title: Regulatory Gap Index
ideas.description: Track regulatory gaps as strategic terrain — where regulations lag technology, where incumbents over-comply, where changes are coming.

ideas.title: Doctrine Version Control
ideas.description: Track MEMOLA doctrine evolution with version numbers, change logs, evidence for changes, and open questions.

ideas.title: Archetype Refinement
ideas.description: Decompose 'vertical platform' into sub-categories: developer, enterprise, consumer, professional, data, logistics verticals.

ideas.title: Existential Risk Scoring
ideas.description: Add to entity schema: dependency_death, platform_absorption, technology_leapfrog, regulatory_geopolitical, capital_starvation scores.

ideas.title: MEMOLA-Adaptive Skill
ideas.description: A skill for edge cases (2.5-3.5 diagnosis scores) providing scoped engagement protocols, risk mitigation strategies, and clear boundaries for mixed-terrain work.

ideas.title: Regional Skill Template
ideas.description: Instead of MEMOLA-Berlin, MEMOLA-France, etc., create MEMOLA-Regional as a template with parameter files that calibrate for specific regions. Reduces skill proliferation while enabling localization.

ideas.title: Skill Dependency Graph
ideas.description: Formalize skill relationships: required dependencies (Diagnosis before all), optional enhancements (Local, Creative), conflict detection. Makes skill architecture explicit.

ideas.title: Annual Skill Audit Protocol
ideas.description: Yearly review of all skills against core doctrine alignment, usage patterns, gap identification, and deprecation candidates. Prevents skill drift and proliferation.
